timeline.message: feat: copy container service from track 1

replies.bodyText: The track1-naming is used to generate code with naming as track1, "with***" instead of "set***". cc @weidongxu-microsoft
replies.author: ChenTanyi

replies.bodyText:
Background, we use the flag as option to keep both naming pattern open.
I probably going to put it to gulp.js, so this is enabled globally.
replies.author: weidongxu-microsoft

replies.bodyText: Should keep track-1 as default. And add 'azure-core-style' as alternative.
replies.author: yaohaizh

timeline.bodyText: should we use azure kubernetes service now?
timeline.author: yungezz
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,147 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
+    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
+    <parent>
+        <groupId>com.azure</groupId>
+        <artifactId>azure-parent</artifactId>
+        <version>2.0.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
+        <relativePath>../pom.xml</relativePath>
+    </parent>
+
+    <artifactId>azure-mgmt-containerservice</artifactId>
+    <packaging>jar</packaging>
+
+    <name>Microsoft Azure SDK for Container Service Management</name>

replies.bodyText: The Container Service uses the name of the provider. And it include not only kubernetes, but also container service. I think if we want to name it to kubernetes, we need to separate these two service.
replies.author: ChenTanyi

timeline.author: yungezz
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,147 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
+<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">

replies.bodyText: I'm not sure about it, all the poms are used it in this project. Meanwhile, since we will migrate back to sdk, may it be ok?
replies.author: ChenTanyi

timeline.bodyText: same here, should we change namespace to kubernets service?
timeline.author: yungezz
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,103 @@
+// Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.
+// Licensed under the MIT License. See License.txt in the project root for
+// license information.
+// 
+// Code generated by Microsoft (R) AutoRest Code Generator.
+
+package com.azure.management.containerservice;

replies.bodyText: containerservice here, I think we couldn't change. https://github.com/azure/azure-rest-api-specs/blob/1c3a60403422ca8c73df7eb7c65ae2a3c90bf152/specification/containerservice/resource-manager/readme.md#L1
replies.author: ChenTanyi

replies.bodyText:
@yungezz this namespace is defined in readme.md by the service team when write the Swagger spec. All the SDK will have the similar namespace.
FYI:
ContainerService: AKS
ContainerInstance: ACI
ContainerRegistry: ACR
replies.author: yaohaizh

timeline.bodyText: seems one change in azure core is to generalize exception, not using CloudError, is this fluent layer?
timeline.author: yungezz
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,42 @@
+// Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.
+// Licensed under the MIT License. See License.txt in the project root for
+// license information.
+// 
+// Code generated by Microsoft (R) AutoRest Code Generator.
+
+package com.azure.management.containerservice;
+
+import com.azure.core.annotation.Fluent;
+import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty;
+
+/**
+ * The CloudError model.
+ */
+@Fluent
+public final class CloudError {

replies.bodyText: This is a generated class, which is defined by swagger. They use spatial cloud error rather than common one.
replies.author: ChenTanyi

replies.bodyText: This could be a generator bug. CloudError and CloudException is defined in Core Management. Hence generator does not need to generate CloudError class.
replies.author: weidongxu-microsoft
